Click to start drawing the circle (Max Radius 1000 m).

tooltips.clickOnFeatureToMove: Click and drag the feature to move
tooltips.drawHoleOnPolygon: Draw over the polygon to create a hole

Click building to add entrance
Click and drag to modify

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: Click on a object in the map.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add the missing {missingVar} in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example the mapillary images can be used.

osmMode.note: Note: the {layerNameVar} layer is updated every 10 minutes

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The displayed icons in the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add to the POIs the missing tag 'opening_hours' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, the website of the amenity can be viewed or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add to the ways the missing tag 'maxspeed' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add to the ways the missing tag 'surface' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add to the ways the missing tag 'width' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add the missing tag 'segregated' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Edit the tag 'building' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary and aerial images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

stepsDesc.clickFeatureInMap: The blue lines on the map are the challenges. Select one of them.
stepsDesc.clickEditWithOsm: By clicking on the 'Edit with OSM' link, you will be forwarded to the OSM iD-Editor.
stepsDesc.fillInOSMiD: Add the tag 'parking:lane:both' or 'parking:lane:left' and/or 'parking:lane:right' in the OSM editor according to the guidelines of the OSM wiki. To retrieve the missing information, for example, mapillary and aerial images can be used or an on-site visit can be made.

dialogMessage.title: OSM Mapping Mode
dialogMessage.body: Welcome to the OSM mapping mode! In this mode, you can improve GOAT data by contributing to OpenStreetMap (OSM). We have set up different tasks for objects with missing information, which can be completed using the iD-Editor or other OSM editors such as JOSM. Please familiarize yourself with the general mapping rules and the corresponding content of the OSM wiki for the objects you want to edit. Furthermore, you can find a tutorial on mapping in OSM on the GOAT website. Thanks for contributing to the world of open data!
